intro: Lastrea melanochlamys, commonly known as the black-chalmed lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with cylindrical, blue-green leaves that are densely covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and appear in clusters during the warmer months. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in rock gardens and succulent collections.
